revised_title: A Reevaluation of Schottky's Theory of Rectification and the Role of Semi-Conductors
tldr: The authors analyze Schottky's theory of rectification and the role of semi-conductors in crystal contacts. They discuss the limitations of the original theory and propose an extension using the wave mechanical theory of semi-conductors. The authors explain the asymmetry in the current-voltage curve and the large additional resistance in crystal rectifiers, which is caused by the reflection of electrons at the transition layer.
